com.codemelon.graph.graph

Class KruskalGraph<E extends SpanningTreeEdgeData>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.codemelon.graph.graph.AbstractGraph<V>
      • com.codemelon.graph.graph.UndirectedEdgeDataGraph<E,V>
        • com.codemelon.graph.graph.UndirectedWeightedEdgeGraph<E,UndirectedKruskalVertex<E>>
          • com.codemelon.graph.graph.KruskalGraph<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WeightedEdgeGraph

    public class KruskalGraph<E extends SpanningTreeEdgeData>
extends UndirectedWeightedEdgeGraph<E,UndirectedKruskalVertex<E>>
    Utility class that eliminates a type parameter from UndirectedWeightedEdgeGraph by specifying V as an UndirectedKruskalVertex.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.codemelon.graph.graph.WeightedEdgeGraph

        DEFAULT_WEIGHT_EPSILON

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      KruskalGraph()
      Initialize graph to a default initial capacity of 16 vertices
      KruskalGraph(java.util.Collection<UndirectedKruskalVertex<E>> vertices)
      Use the vertices in a collection as the initial vertices in the graph
      KruskalGraph(java.util.Collection<UndirectedKruskalVertex<E>> vertices, double weightEpsilon)
      Use the vertices in a collection as the initial vertices in the graph and set weight epsilon to the specified value.
      KruskalGraph(double weightEpsilon)
      Initialize an empty graph using the given value for weightEpsilon and default initial capacity.
      KruskalGraph(int initialCapacity)
      Initialize graph to have capacity for the given number of vertices
      KruskalGraph(int initialCapacity, double weightEpsilon)
      Initialize an empty graph to have capacity for the given number of vertices and the specified weight epsilon.

    • Constructor Detail

      • KruskalGraph

        public KruskalGraph(java.util.Collection<UndirectedKruskalVertex<E>> vertices,
            double weightEpsilon)
        Use the vertices in a collection as the initial vertices in the graph and set weight epsilon to the specified value.
        Parameters:
        vertices - collection of vertices that will make up the initial vertices of the graph
        weightEpsilon - weight epsilon to be used to determine weight equality in this graph

      • KruskalGraph

        public KruskalGraph(double weightEpsilon)
        Initialize an empty graph using the given value for weightEpsilon and default initial capacity. The input value must be greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        weightEpsilon - weight epsilon to be used to determine weight equality in this graph

      • KruskalGraph

        public KruskalGraph(int initialCapacity,
            double weightEpsilon)
        Initialize an empty graph to have capacity for the given number of vertices and the specified weight epsilon.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - expected number of vertices in the graph
        weightEpsilon - weight epsilon to be used to determine weight equality in this graph

      • KruskalGraph

        public KruskalGraph()
        Initialize graph to a default initial capacity of 16 vertices
